Key Match Events: Baris Yilmaz collects a second yellow card and is sent off in the 64th minute
Aaron Ramsey heads a chance over the top in the 6th minute
Joe Rodon fails to convert from close range in the 18th minute
Sorba Thomas breaks through the lines and lobbed the goalkeeper in the 37th minute, but the goal is disallowed for offside
Pre-Game Insights: Wales' early team news features Ethan Ampadu and Aaron Ramsey retaining the captaincy
Turkey's early team news includes the return of Çağlar Soyuncu after missing the summer tournament through injury
Craig Bellamy hopes to introduce a new style of play with Wales
Turkey have more quality in their ranks, but Wales should be able to get at least a draw according to predictions
Post-Match Reflections: Former Wales striker Helen Ward is pleased with the performance and describes it as the best Welsh performance in a long time
Luton Town defender Tom Lockyer speaks on BBC Radio 5 Sports Extra, stating that Wales were outstanding in the first half but couldn't capitalize on their dominance
Craig Bellamy brings excitement back to Wales as new era gets off to a promising start
Miscellaneous Highlights: The first half was very positive and if Craig Bellamy's men can replicate that in the next 45 minutes the fans will all go home pleased regardless of the result
The rain is hammering down in Cardiff now but Craig Bellamy doesn’t seem affected at all. He’s busy getting a couple of substitutions ready to ignite a spark into Wales' play
Wales had 15 shots tonight but only one of them hit the target and that was in the first half
